requirement_tested: A wheel of fortune interface that users can spin to win prizes
user_persona: A casual visitor named Alex who is curious about the game.
user_goal: To successfully spin the wheel and see what prize they win.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting the Site
narrative_steps.description: Alex lands on the homepage and sees a large wheel with colorful segments and a 'Spin' button below it.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The wheel is centered with a title 'Spin to Win!', and a dark red 'Spin' button is visible beneath it against a light gray background.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Spin
narrative_steps.description: Excited to try, Alex clicks the 'Spin' button to start the game.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The wheel begins rotating with smooth animation, and the 'Spin' button becomes disabled until the spin completes.

narrative_steps.title: Receiving Result
narrative_steps.description: After a few seconds, the wheel slows down and stops at a random segment. A modal pops up showing the result.
narrative_steps.action: Wait for the spin to complete.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal appears displaying the prize name and a congratulatory message such as 'Congratulations! You've won [Prize Name]'.

requirement_tested: A display section showing all available prizes
user_persona: Returning user Sam who wants to know what prizes are available before spinning.
user_goal: To view the list of all available prizes and their details.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Prize List
narrative_steps.description: Sam scrolls down or looks around the page to find the prize information.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A dedicated section titled 'Prize List' is displayed below or beside the wheel, featuring a responsive grid or table layout.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Prizes
narrative_steps.description: Sam examines the list of prizes shown in the grid or table format.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each item includes an image thumbnail, prize name, and probability percentage, styled with alternating row colors and dark red headers.

requirement_tested: A user-specific section displaying their winning records
user_persona: Frequent player Jordan who wants to track their past winnings.
user_goal: To review their personal history of won prizes from previous spins.

narrative_steps.title: Finding Winnings Section
narrative_steps.description: Jordan scrolls to the bottom of the page looking for their personal records.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A scrollable table titled 'My Winnings' is displayed with columns for Date & Time, Prize Won, and Status.

narrative_steps.title: Checking History
narrative_steps.description: Jordan reviews the entries in the table to recall previously won prizes.
narrative_steps.action: Examine the rows in the table.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Rows alternate between white and light gray backgrounds, with headers styled in dark red, showing accurate historical data.

requirement_tested: Frontend fetching all dynamic data from backend APIs
user_persona: Tech-savvy tester Morgan verifying correct integration.
user_goal: To ensure that dynamic content loads properly via API calls.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Page Content
narrative_steps.description: Morgan opens the site and watches how the dynamic sections load.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Loading indicators appear briefly in sections like Wheel Interface, Prize List, and Winning Records before populating content fetched from backend APIs.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Data Sources
narrative_steps.description: Morgan inspects network activity to confirm API usage.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Requests are made to GET /api/prizes, GET /api/history, and POST /api/spin, confirming frontend fetches all dynamic data from backend services.

requirement_tested: Backend connecting to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_goal: To verify that the backend connects securely to the PostgreSQL database using predefined credentials.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Backend Configuration
narrative_steps.description: Riley checks the backend codebase for database connection settings.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Database connection is established using environment variables: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming Database Connection
narrative_steps.description: Riley ensures the backend can perform queries against the database.
narrative_steps.action: Run a sample query through the backend.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Backend successfully executes queries against the configured PostgreSQL instance using the pg client library.

requirement_tested: Database schema supporting prize definitions and user winning records
user_persona: Database administrator Taylor ensuring proper schema design.
user_goal: To validate that the database schema supports storing prizes and user winning records.

narrative_steps.title: Examining Prizes Table
narrative_steps.description: Taylor reviews the database schema for the prizes table.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The 'prizes' table exists with columns: id (SERIAL PRIMARY KEY), name (VARCHAR), description (TEXT), image_url (TEXT), and probability (DECIMAL).

narrative_steps.title: Examining Winnings Table
narrative_steps.description: Taylor verifies the structure of the winnings table.
narrative_steps.action: Check the schema of the winnings table.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The 'winnings' table has columns: id (SERIAL PRIMARY KEY), user_identifier (TEXT), prize_id (INTEGER REFERENCES prizes(id)), and timestamp (TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP).

requirement_tested: Functionality to record each user's spin result in the database
user_persona: QA engineer Casey validating data persistence.
user_goal: To confirm that each spin result is saved accurately in the database.

narrative_steps.title: Triggering a Spin
narrative_steps.description: Casey performs a spin action on the website.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Spin' button and wait for completion.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A prize is determined and returned from the POST /api/spin endpoint.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Record Insertion
narrative_steps.description: Casey checks the database to ensure the spin result was recorded.
narrative_steps.action: Query the 'winnings' table for the latest entry.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A new record is inserted into the 'winnings' table containing the user identifier, prize ID, and timestamp.

requirement_tested: Visual feedback during the wheel spinning animation
user_persona: UX-focused designer Pat evaluating engagement factors.
user_goal: To ensure the spinning animation provides satisfying visual feedback.

narrative_steps.title: Starting the Spin
narrative_steps.description: Pat clicks the spin button to observe the animation behavior.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The wheel starts rotating smoothly with CSS transitions or JavaScript-based animation simulating realistic rotation deceleration.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Completion
narrative_steps.description: Pat watches the wheel slow down and stop naturally.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The wheel gradually slows down and stops at a random segment, providing clear visual indication of the outcome.

requirement_tested: Responsive design with light gray background and dark red styled components
user_persona: Mobile user Quinn accessing the site on a phone.
user_goal: To experience a well-designed and responsive interface matching brand colors.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing on Mobile Device
narrative_steps.description: Quinn visits the site using a smartphone browser.
narrative_steps.action: Open the site on a mobile device.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The entire website uses a light gray (#D3D3D3) background, and all interactive elements, headers, and highlights are styled in dark red (#8B0000).

narrative_steps.title: Testing Responsiveness
narrative_steps.description: Quinn interacts with various parts of the site to check responsiveness.
narrative_steps.action: Resize viewport or navigate through sections.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adjusts gracefully from desktop to mobile views using media queries, maintaining readability and usability.

requirement_tested: Landing page explaining how to use the wheel of fortune
user_persona: First-time visitor Robin unfamiliar with the game.
user_goal: To understand how to play the wheel of fortune from the landing page.

narrative_steps.title: Reading Landing Page Content
narrative_steps.description: Robin lands on the homepage and reads the introductory content.
narrative_steps.action: Read the top section of the page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: There is a welcoming headline ('Try Your Luck Today!'), a short instructional paragraph, and a hero image of the wheel.

narrative_steps.title: Using Navigation Links
narrative_steps.description: Robin clicks one of the call-to-action buttons to explore further.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: 'Start Playing' scrolls down to the wheel interface, and 'View Prizes' navigates to or reveals the prize listing section.

requirement_tested: Authentication or identification mechanism to track individual user records
user_persona: Regular user Devon wanting to maintain their progress.
user_goal: To have their spins tracked under a consistent identity across sessions.

narrative_steps.title: Initial Visit Identification
narrative_steps.description: Devon visits the site for the first time and gets assigned an identifier.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A unique user ID is generated and stored in localStorage using localStorage.setItem('userId', uuid).

narrative_steps.title: Subsequent Visit Recognition
narrative_steps.description: Devon returns later and expects their previous actions to be recognized.
narrative_steps.action: Reload the page after closing the browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The same userId is retrieved from localStorage, allowing continuity of records without needing login.

requirement_tested: API endpoint to retrieve current user's winning history
user_persona: Application developer Austin integrating frontend with backend.
user_goal: To consume the winning history endpoint and display user-specific data.

narrative_steps.title: Calling History Endpoint
narrative_steps.description: Austin triggers a request to get the user's winning history.
narrative_steps.action: Make a GET request to /api/history with authentication header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Endpoint responds with a JSON array of past spins including timestamps and prize references, filtered by user context.

narrative_steps.title: Rendering History
narrative_steps.description: Austin maps the received data to UI components.
narrative_steps.action: Populate the 'My Winnings' table with API response.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Accurate historical data is rendered in the table, showing dates, prizes, and statuses correctly.

requirement_tested: API endpoint to fetch the list of available prizes
user_persona: Frontend developer Blair building the prize display component.
user_goal: To fetch and render the complete list of available prizes dynamically.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Prize Data
narrative_steps.description: Blair initiates a call to retrieve all available prizes.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Endpoint returns a JSON array containing objects with id, name, description, image_url, and probability for each prize.

narrative_steps.title: Displaying Prizes
narrative_steps.description: Blair binds the fetched data to the frontend grid or table.
narrative_steps.action: Render prize items in the 'Prize List' section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All prizes are displayed visually with thumbnails, names, and probabilities as per the API response.

requirement_tested: API endpoint to process a wheel spin and return the result
user_persona: Game logic developer Cameron implementing core functionality.
user_goal: To handle spin processing and return appropriate prize results.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Spin Request
narrative_steps.description: Cameron sends a request to simulate a user spinning the wheel.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server processes the request, determines a prize based on probabilities, saves the result, and returns a structured JSON response.

narrative_steps.title: Handling Response
narrative_steps.description: Cameron validates the response structure and prize selection logic.
narrative_steps.action: Parse the response from the endpoint.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Response matches format { success: true, prizeId: number, prizeName: string }, indicating successful processing and accurate prize determination.

requirement_tested: Package.json configured with `install:all` and `dev` scripts running both frontend and backend
user_persona: New team member Drew setting up the project locally.
user_goal: To easily install dependencies and run both frontend and backend together.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Drew clones the repo and runs the setup command.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies are installed concurrently using concurrently package.

narrative_steps.title: Running Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Drew starts the development environment.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Concurrently launches both frontend and backend development servers, enabling simultaneous development and testing.
